*Nationwide measures*    Educational area  "Meetings for training and further education purposes may only take place for people from the same household. Otherwise, training and further training may only take place for as many people as is necessary.    "For elementary educational institutions, institutions for out-of-school childcare and child minders, there is an obligation to provide evidence of a negative PCR test twice a week. The test must not have been carried out more than 72 hours ago.     "The schools are open to everyone who needs them. It is mandatory to wear a mask in the entire school building, as well as in class and group rooms.    "For further binding regulations see  COVID-19 School Ordinance 2021/22  and  COVID-19 University Act .    "From week 38, the Corona Commission will determine the epidemiological risk for the educational institutions per federal state. On the basis of this classification, the Education Directorate determines the risk level for the federal state in agreement with the central office by ordinance. The responsible education directorate then informs the schools. Defined framework conditions also enable flexible measures to be taken at the school location. Further information can be found on the website of the  Federal Ministry of Education, Science and Research (BMBWF)"    *Corona traffic light map*  On December 2nd, 2021, the Corona Commission classifies all of Austria and all federal states as a very high risk.   The classification for the education sector is risk level III.    *Coronavirus - Current Measures*     School:  â¢	School for everyone who needs it  â¢	The timetable remains upright  â¢	A mask requirement applies to all school levels in the school building as well as in class and group rooms.  â¢	However, children are allowed to stay at home without a doctor's certificate. Schools provide care and learning packages for these children.  â¢	Details can be found on the website of the Ministry of Education    Sources:  https://archive.vn/K9UCW#selection-597.0-605.62 [Corona traffic light map]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

Nationwide measures  Educational area  The rules of meetings apply to extracurricular youth education, youth work and supervised holiday camps. In addition, the following applies:  â¢	Individuals may participate with a 2.5G certificate  â¢	A maximum of four supervisors per group of 25 participants is permitted.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. This also applies to operators.    For elementary educational institutions, institutions for out-of-school childcare and child minders, there is an obligation to provide evidence of a negative PCR test twice a week. The test must not have been carried out more than 72 hours ago.     The schools are open to everyone who needs them. It is mandatory to wear a mask in the entire school building, as well as in class and group rooms. If students are in the school building and do not have 2G evidence, antigen or PCR tests must be carried out at least twice a week. However, these must be carried out so often that valid evidence must be presented for each day of the teaching week.    From week 38, the Corona Commission will determine the epidemiological risk for the educational institutions per federal state. On the basis of this classification, the Education Directorate determines the risk level for the federal state in agreement with the central office by ordinance. The responsible education directorate then informs the schools. Defined framework conditions also enable flexible measures to be taken at the school location.    **Corona traffic light map**  On December 9th, 2021 the Corona Commission classifies all of Austria and all federal states as a very high risk.     The classification for the education sector is risk level III.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/mKGBo [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/XRh8n  [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/C8xH8 [Corona traffic light map]

Educational area  For extracurricular youth education, youth work and supervised holiday camps, the rules of the get-togethers apply. In addition, the following applies:    Individuals may participate with a 2.5G certificate  A maximum of four supervisors per group of 25 participants is permitted.  If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. This also applies to operators.  For elementary educational institutions, institutions for out-of-school childcare and child minders, there is an obligation to provide evidence of a negative PCR test twice a week. The test must not have been carried out more than 72 hours ago.     The schools are open to everyone who needs them. It is mandatory to wear a mask in the entire school building, as well as in class and group rooms. If students are in the school building and do not have 2G evidence, antigen or PCR tests must be carried out at least twice a week. However, these must be carried out so often that valid evidence must be presented for each day of the teaching week.    For further binding regulations see  COVID-19 School Ordinance 2021/22  and its  amendments   as well as  COVID-19 Higher Education Act .    From week 38, the Corona Commission will determine the epidemiological risk for the educational institutions per federal state. On the basis of this classification, the Education Directorate determines the risk level for the federal state in agreement with the central office by ordinance. The responsible education directorate then informs the schools. Defined framework conditions also enable flexible measures to be taken at the school location. Further information can be found on the website of the  Federal Ministry of Education, Science and Research (BMBWF).    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20211217202434/https://corona-ampel.gv.at/aktuelle-massnahmen/bundesweite-massnahmen/

Targeted geographical response framework  From week 38, the Corona Commission will determine the epidemiological risk for the educational institutions per federal state. On the basis of this classification, the Education Directorate determines the risk level for the federal state in agreement with the central office by ordinance. The responsible education directorate then informs the schools. Defined framework conditions also enable flexible measures to be taken at the school location.    Schools open   The schools are open to everyone who needs them. It is mandatory to wear a mask in the entire school building, as well as in class and group rooms. If students are in the school building and do not have 2G evidence, antigen or PCR tests must be carried out at least twice a week. However, these must be carried out so often that valid evidence must be presented for each day of the teaching week.    For elementary educational institutions, institutions for out-of-school childcare and child minders, there is an obligation to provide evidence of a negative PCR test twice a week. The test must not have been carried out more than 72 hours ago.     Holidays  The rules of meetings apply to extracurricular youth education, youth work and supervised holiday camps. In addition, the following applies:  â¢	Individuals may participate with a 2.5G certificate  â¢	A maximum of four supervisors per group of 25 participants is permitted.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. This also applies to operators.    Source: https://archive.vn/7k1YB#selection-2701.0-2701.16 [Nationwide measures]

*Nationwide measures*  At work  â¢	The professional activity should preferably take place outside the workplace, if this is possible and both employer: in and employee: in agree.  â¢	Employees, owners and operators are only allowed to enter workplaces where physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out if they have a 3G certificate. (A maximum of two physical contacts per day, which take place outdoors and each do not last longer than 15 minutes, are not considered to be contacts).  â¢	An FFP2 mask should be worn if physical contact with people cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	The owner of a place of work with more than 51 employees must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	With regard to the wearing of a mask and the submission of evidence of a low epidemiological risk, stricter regulations that go beyond this ordinance can be provided in justified cases.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. This also applies to operators.  â¢	Workplaces in the health and care sector may only be entered with a 2G proof and an additional negative PCR test. In retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled as well as in hospitals and health resorts and other places where health services are provided, wearing an FFP2 mask in closed rooms is also mandatory. (Exception: operators: inside, employees may, as an exception, admit an authorized body with a negative antigen test, provided that no negative PCR test can be presented due to lack of availability or an evaluation that is not timely. This also applies accordingly to the operators: Inside).    Customer areas  â¢	Business premises of the trade, body-related services and leisure or cultural facilities are not allowed to be entered. The exception is the collection of pre-ordered goods, whereby an FFP2 mask must be worn. In addition, retail outlets may not be open longer than 7 p.m.  â¢	Customer areas for services that are not close to the body may only be entered with 2G proof.  â¢	There are exceptions for operating facilities for daily needs such as pharmacies, grocery stores, banks, (electricity) filling stations, etc.  â¢	Entering the customer area of business premises is only permitted for customers with an FFP2 mask. If, due to the nature of the service, the customer cannot wear an FFP2 mask, this is only permitted if the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.    Gastronomy and accommodation    Gastronomy  â¢	The catering is closed.  â¢	(Exceptions are catering establishments in hospitals and health resorts, old people's and nursing homes as well as inpatient residential facilities for the disabled, facilities for the care and accommodation of children and young people and companies for people who are exclusively cared for, accommodated or not staying there for mere visits).  â¢	There is an FFP2 mask requirement for customers. Furthermore, the consumption of food and drinks is not permitted in the immediate vicinity of the dispensing point and may only be consumed while sitting at the dispensing stations. Self-service is permitted, provided that the risk of infection can be minimized through special hygienic precautions.  â¢	With the FFP2 mask, it is permitted to collect food and alcohol-free beverages as well as alcoholic beverages that are filled in commercially available sealed containers.    Accommodation  â¢	Accommodation establishments (including campsites and shelters) are closed.  â¢	(Exceptions, the purpose of looking after and providing assistance to people in need of support, professional reasons that cannot be postponed, satisfying an urgent need for housing, spa guests or patients and their accompanying persons in a spa or rehabilitation facility, as well as for pupils for the purpose of attending school and students Study purposes).  â¢	Persons who were already in accommodation at the time this provision came into force or for whom in advance with the accommodation provider: in the agreed period of accommodation, an exception can be made.  â¢	When entering the FFP2 mask requirement applies.    Leisure, sport and culture    Leisure  Leisure facilities (such as leisure and amusement parks, baths, dance schools, facilities for practicing prostitution, animal parks, etc.) are closed.    Culture and culture  Art and cultural institutions (museums, art halls, cultural exhibition halls, libraries, libraries, archives, theaters, cinemas, variety theaters, cabarets, concert halls and arenas) are closed.    Sport  â¢	Indoor sports facilities are closed (exceptions: outdoor sports facilities, top athletes, disabled sports, professional athletes and their supervisors and trainers as well as representatives of the media).  â¢	Outdoor sports facilities are open, but sports may only be practiced with people who live in the same household, the partner who does not live in the same household, individual closest relatives such as parents, children and siblings or individual important caregivers. Lingering in the sports facility is limited to the duration of the exercise.  o	Only sports without physical contact may be practiced.  o	In non-public sports facilities, only people with a 2G certificate have access.  o	Closed areas of the sports facility may only be entered if this is necessary for outdoor sports.  â¢	Top athletes:  o	When top athletes practice sports, the responsible doctor must develop a COVID-19 prevention concept and monitor compliance with it on an ongoing basis.  o	Top athletes, as well as their supervisors and trainers, have to show a 3G certificate for training and competitions if physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out.  o	If a SARS-CoV-2 infection becomes known to an athlete, supervisor or trainer, all athletes, supervisors and trainers must undergo a molecular biological test or an antigen test for the presence of a SARS-CoV- 2 to undergo infection.      *Coronavirus - Current Measures*    Place of professional activity:  â¢ General home office recommendation, federal employees also work from home    Customer areas, trade & services:  â¢ Business premises of the trade as well as body-related services, leisure facilities and cultural facilities are not allowed to be entered.  â¢ Customer areas for services that are not close to the body may only be entered upon presentation of a 2-G certificate. Customers also have to wear a mask. If this is not possible due to the nature of the service, other suitable protective measures must be taken to minimize the risk of infection.  â¢ Exceptions are permanent establishments of the universal service. Only goods may be offered that correspond to the typical range of goods at the business premises. Here customers have to wear an FFP 2 mask, for example :  	o	public pharmacies  	o	Grocery retailers and farm direct marketers  	o	Drug stores and drug stores  	o	Banks  	o	Gas stations  â¢ The opening times of the retail outlets that sell goods are limited to 7 p.m.    Gastronomy:  â¢ Gastronomy facilities may only be entered for the collection of food and alcohol-free alcoholic beverages that are filled in commercially closed containers. A mask must be worn here. Consumption is not permitted within a 50 m radius .  â¢ Take away from restaurants is still possible all day.  â¢ Advent and Christmas markets are currently not allowed to take place.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

**Nationwide measures**  At work  â¢	The professional activity should preferably take place outside the workplace, if this is possible and both employer: in and employee: in agree.  â¢	Employees, owners and operators may only enter workplaces where physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out if they have a 3G certificate. (A maximum of two physical contacts per day, which take place outdoors and each do not last longer than 15 minutes, are not considered to be contacts).  â¢	An FFP2 mask should be worn if physical contact with people cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	The owner of a place of work with more than 51 employees must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	With regard to the wearing of a mask and the submission of evidence of a low epidemiological risk, stricter regulations that go beyond this ordinance can be provided in justified cases.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. This also applies to operators.      Leisure, sport and culture  leisure  Access to leisure facilities (such as leisure and amusement parks, baths, dance schools, facilities for practicing prostitution, animal parks, etc.) is only permitted for people with a 2G certificate.  â¢	The FFP2 mask requirement applies in closed rooms  â¢	The opening times are only permitted between 5:00 a.m. and 11:00 p.m.  â¢	Operators of leisure facilities must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  Culture and culture  Access to art and cultural institutions (museums, art halls, cultural exhibition halls, libraries, libraries, archives, theaters, cinemas, variety theaters, cabarets, concert halls and arenas) is only permitted with 2G proof.  â¢	The FFP2 mask requirement applies in closed rooms  â¢	The opening times are only permitted between 5:00 a.m. and 11:00 p.m.  â¢	Operators of leisure facilities must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  Sports  â¢	Entering sports facilities for the purpose of doing sports is only permitted under certain conditions:  o	A 2G certificate applies to non-public sports facilities as well as an FFP2 mask requirement in closed rooms.  o	 The opening times of sports facilities are only permitted between 5 a.m. and 11 p.m.  â¢	Outdoor sports facilities are open to everyone regardless of the 2G certificate, whereby sports may only be practiced with people who live in the same household, the partner who does not live in the same household, individual closest relatives such as parents, children and siblings or individual important reference persons. Lingering in the sports facility is limited to the duration of the exercise.  â¢	Only sports without physical contact may be practiced.  â¢	In non-public sports facilities, only people with a 2G certificate have access.  â¢	Closed areas of the sports facility may only be entered if this is necessary for outdoor sports.  â¢	The operator of non-public sports facilities must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	Top athletes:  o	When top athletes practice sport, the responsible doctor must develop a COVID-19 prevention concept and monitor compliance with it on an ongoing basis.  o	Top athletes, as well as their supervisors and trainers, have to show a 3G certificate for training and competitions if physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out. In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.  o	If a SARS-CoV-2 infection becomes known to an athlete, supervisor or trainer, all athletes, supervisors and trainers must undergo a molecular biological test or an antigen test for the presence of a SARS-CoV- 2 to undergo infection.    Customer areas  â¢	 Retail establishments as well as (close to the body) services may only be entered with valid 2-G proof.  â¢	Exceptions to the 2-G obligation are basic supply facilities, such as: public pharmacies, grocery stores and rural direct marketers, drug stores and drugstores, banks, petrol stations  â¢	The FFP2 mask requirement applies in closed rooms when entering and driving the customer area of business premises as well as the connecting structures of structurally connected business premises (e.g. shopping centers, market halls).  â¢	The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	The opening times of business premises are only permitted between 5:00 a.m. and 11:00 p.m.    Gastronomy and accommodation  gastronomy  â¢	The catering is open to customers with a valid 2G certificate.  â¢	Each customer must be assigned a seat and the business premises must only be entered between 5 a.m. and 11 p.m.  â¢	The consumption of food and drinks must not take place in the immediate vicinity of the dispensing point and only while sitting at the dispensing stations. In the open air, food and drink stands may also be consumed while standing at administration points.  â¢	The FFP2 mask requirement applies in closed rooms, but not while staying at the administration area.  â¢	The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	Exceptions are operating modes of the hospitality industry in hospitals and health resorts, retirement and nursing homes as well as inpatient residential facilities for the disabled, facilities for the care and accommodation of children and young people including schools and elementary educational facilities and companies, if these are used exclusively by employees or people who work there .  â¢	Self-service is permitted, provided that the risk of infection can be (A maximum of two physical contacts per day, which take place outdoors and each do not last longer than 15 minutes, are not considered to be contacts).  â¢	An FFP2 mask should be worn if physical contact with people cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	The owner of a place of work with more than 51 employees must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	With regard to the wearing of a mask and the submission of evidence of a low epidemiological risk, stricter regulations that go beyond this ordinance can be provided in justified cases.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. All-day exit restrictions apply - essentially preventing public events.  Exceptions are in place (for example demonstrations "Assemblies according to the assembly law")    Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

Meetings  Generally:  â¢	Organizers have to collect contact details.  â¢	Organizers have to appoint a: n COVID-19 officer: n and draw up a COVID-19 prevention concept.  Indoor without assigned seats:  â¢	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  â¢	An FFP2 mask is required.  â¢	Maximum limit: max. 25 people (including family reunions, birthday parties, wedding parties, Christmas parties, etc.)  Indoor with assigned seats:  â¢	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  â¢	There is an FFP2 mask requirement, also at the seat.  â¢	Obligation to notify from 50 people  â¢	Authorization required from 250 people  â¢	Maximum limit: max. 2,000 people  Outdoor with no assigned seating:  â¢	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  â¢	Obligation to notify from 50 people  â¢	Authorization required from 250 people  â¢	Maximum limit: max. 300 people  Outdoor with assigned seating:  â¢	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  â¢	Obligation to notify from 50 people  â¢	Authorization required from 250 people  â¢	Maximum limit: max. 4,000 people    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20211217201842/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html

The nation-wide lockdown ended on 12 December. However, 2G (vaccinated + recovered entry only) rule applies for public events. https://web.archive.org/web/20211218134848/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-MaÃnahmen.html

Public events are in effect cancelled for the non-vaccinated (restricted from leaving home except for specifc exceptions). Proof of vaccination required for those with 2G proof.    **Nationwide measures: meetings**  â¢	For meetings of more than 50 people, the organizers must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept. This does not apply to meetings in private living quarters.    â¢	For meetings in closed rooms and  without  assigned seats:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Maximum limit: max. 25 people (including family get-togethers, birthday parties, wedding parties, Christmas parties, etc.    â¢	For meetings in closed rooms and  with  assigned seats:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Obligation to notify from 50 people  o	Authorization required from 250 people  o	Maximum limit: max. 2,000 people    â¢	Outdoor gatherings:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Obligation to notify from 50 people  o	Authorization required from 250 people  o	Maximum limit: a maximum of 300 people without assigned seats and a maximum of 4,000 people with assigned seats    â¢	This also applies to specialist and public fairs as well as to occasional markets (e.g. Advent markets) or separate areas of occasional markets  . In the case of occasional markets that offer goods, food or drinks for sale, a 2G verification requirement and an FFP2 mask requirement apply in closed rooms.    â¢	If there are more than 50 participants, the 2G rule and the recording of contact data do not apply to gatherings of a maximum of four people from fewer than three households plus six underage children of these people and minors for whom these people perform existing supervisory duties.    Source: https://archive.vn/7k1YB [Nationwide measures]

Valid 2G proof is required for meetings and events (with a few exceptions), effectively cancelling public events for those without 2G proof.      Corona Ampel Nationwide Measures: meetings  â¢	For meetings without  assigned seats indoor / outdoor the following applies:  	o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof, as well as a  	o	Maximum limit of 25 people (e.g. for family reunions, birthday parties, wedding parties, Christmas parties, etc.) between 5:00 am and 10:00 pm; Max. 10 people for meetings between 10:00 pm and 5:00 am.    â¢	For meetings with  assigned seats indoor / outdoor the following applies:  	o	Access is permitted depending on the number of people with the following proof:  		ï§	max. 500 people: 2-G certificate  		ï§	max. 1000 people: 2-G detection + PCR test (not older than 72 hours)  		ï§	max. 2000 people: booster vaccination + PCR test (not older than 72 hours)  â¢	This also applies to specialist and public fairs as well as to occasional markets (e.g. Advent markets) or separate areas of occasional markets  . In the case of occasional markets that offer goods, food or drinks for sale, a 2G verification requirement and an FFP2 mask requirement apply in closed rooms.  â¢	If there are more than 50 participants, the 2G rule and the recording of contact data do not apply to gatherings of a maximum of four people from fewer than three households plus six underage children of these people and minors for whom these people perform existing supervisory duties.    â¢	For meetings for rehearsals for professional purposes and for professional artistic performance in a fixed composition, the following also applies:  	o	In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.   	o	If a mask cannot be worn due to the activity, other suitable protective measures must be taken to minimize the risk of infection.  â¢	For meetings within the framework of the labor market service (training and further education, etc.), FFP2 mask requirements as well as 3G proof apply if physical contact cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures. If it is not possible to wear a mask due to the nature of the training or the integration measures of people, the risk of infection must be minimized by means of suitable protective measures.  â¢	Participants: indoors, outside of their own living area, they must always wear an FFP2 mask, but no FFP2 mask is to be worn in private living areas.  â¢	There is a notification requirement from 50 people and a permit requirement from 250 people.  â¢	For meetings of more than 50 people, the organizers must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept. This does not apply to meetings in private living quarters.    Source: https://archive.vn/XMl8n [Corona Ampel Nationwide Measures]

In general, gatherings are kept to those within the household as exit restrictions are in place.  However there are exceptions:    Meetings  â¢	Leaving your own private living space for the purpose of attending meetings is only permitted for the following meetings:  o	Funerals  o	Assemblies according to the assembly law  o	Meetings for professional purposes, if these are necessary to maintain the professional activity  o	meetings of organs of political persons cannot be postponed if they cannot be held in digital form  o	meetings of bodies of legal persons that cannot be postponed, provided that they cannot be held in digital form  o	meetings that cannot be postponed under the Labor Constitution Act  o	Meetings for absolutely necessary vocational training and further education purposes, for the fulfillment of necessary integration measures according to the Integration Act and for final professional examinations, if it is not possible to hold them in digital form  o	Meetings of medical and psychosocial self-help groups  â¢	Personal assistance and 24-hour care are not included in the maximum number of people or households.  If not all participants have a 2G certificate at these gatherings, an FFP2 mask must be worn.  â¢	The following applies to meetings for rehearsals for professional purposes and for professional artistic performance in a fixed composition:  o	 the 3G rule, when physical contact with other people cannot be excluded.  o	In addition, the person responsible for the meeting must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	For meetings within the framework of the labor market service, as well as for other meetings for absolutely necessary vocational training and further education purposes, the 3G certificate applies if physical contact cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	Other exceptions for meetings:  o	Elite sport.  o	Driving in theaters, concert halls and arenas, cinemas, variety theaters and cabarets, if this is done with multi-lane vehicles.  o	rehearsals and artistic performances in a fixed composition without an audience, which are carried out for professional purposes.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

Meetings  â¢	Leaving one's own private living area for the purpose of attending meetings is only permitted for the following meetings without 2G proof:  o	Funerals,  o	Assemblies according to the assembly law,  o	Meetings for professional purposes, if these are necessary to maintain the professional activity,  o	meetings of organs of political persons that cannot be postponed if they cannot be held in digital form,  o	meetings of bodies of legal persons that cannot be postponed, provided that they cannot be held in digital form,  o	meetings that cannot be postponed under the Labor Constitution Act,  o	Meetings of medical and psychosocial self-help groups,  o	driving into theaters, concert halls and arenas, cinemas, variety theaters and cabarets, if this is done with multi-lane vehicles,  o	picking up food and drinks (see paragraph on gastronomy),  o	Meetings in top sport and  o	Meetings for extracurricular youth work.  â¢	Personal assistance and 24-hour care are not included in the maximum number of people or households.  â¢	A mask must be worn in closed rooms. This also applies to meetings outdoors.  â¢	Meetings can only take place between 5:00 am and 11:00 pm.  â¢	For meetings of more than 50 people, the organizers must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	For meetings in closed rooms and  without  assigned seats:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Maximum limit: max. 25 people (including family reunions, birthday parties, wedding parties, Christmas parties, etc.  â¢	For meetings in closed rooms and  with  assigned seats:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Obligation to notify from 50 people  o	Authorization required from 250 people  o	Maximum limit: max. 2,000 people  â¢	Outdoor gatherings:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Obligation to notify from 50 people  o	Authorization required from 250 people  o	Maximum limit: a maximum of 300 people without assigned seats and a maximum of 4,000 people with assigned seats  â¢	This also applies to specialist and public fairs as well as to occasional markets (e.g. Advent markets). In the case of occasional markets that offer goods, food or drinks for sale, a 2G verification requirement and an FFP2 mask requirement apply in closed rooms.  â¢	If there are more than 50 participants, the 2G rule and the recording of contact data do not apply to gatherings of a maximum of four people from fewer than three households plus six underage children of these people and minors for whom these people perform existing supervisory duties.  â¢	For meetings for rehearsals for professional purposes and for professional artistic performance in a fixed composition, the following also applies:  o	In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.   o	If a mask cannot be worn due to the activity, other suitable protective measures must be taken to minimize the risk of infection.  â¢	For meetings within the framework of the Public Employment Service (initial and advanced training, retraining and retraining as well as reintegration into the labor market, final professional exams), the 3G certificate applies if physical contact cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures and wearing an FFP2 mask. If it is not possible to wear a mask due to the nature of the training or the integration measure of people, the risk of infection must be minimized by other suitable protective measures.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/mKGBo [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/XRh8n  [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

Meetings  â¢	Leaving one's own private living area for the purpose of attending meetings is only permitted for the following meetings without 2G proof:  o	Funerals,  o	Assemblies according to the assembly law,  o	Meetings for professional purposes, if these are necessary to maintain the professional activity,  o	meetings of organs of political persons that cannot be postponed if they cannot be held in digital form,  o	meetings of bodies of legal persons that cannot be postponed, provided that they cannot be held in digital form,  o	meetings that cannot be postponed under the Labor Constitution Act,  o	Meetings of medical and psychosocial self-help groups,  o	driving into theaters, concert halls and arenas, cinemas, variety theaters and cabarets, if this is done with multi-lane vehicles,  o	picking up food and drinks (see paragraph on gastronomy),  o	Meetings in top sport and  o	Meetings for extracurricular youth work.  â¢	Personal assistance and 24-hour care are not included in the maximum number of people or households.  â¢	A mask must be worn in closed rooms. This also applies to meetings outdoors.  â¢	Meetings are only allowed between 5:00 am and 11:00 pm.  â¢	For meetings of more than 50 people, the organizers must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept. This does not apply to meetings in private living quarters.  â¢	For meetings in closed rooms and  without  assigned seats:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Maximum limit: max. 25 people (including family get-togethers, birthday parties, wedding parties, Christmas parties, etc.  â¢	For meetings in closed rooms and  with  assigned seats:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Obligation to notify from 50 people  o	Authorization required from 250 people  o	Maximum limit: max. 2,000 people  â¢	Outdoor gatherings:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Obligation to notify from 50 people  o	Authorization required from 250 people  o	Maximum limit: a maximum of 300 people without assigned seats and a maximum of 4,000 people with assigned seats  â¢	This also applies to specialist and public fairs as well as to occasional markets (e.g. Advent markets). In the case of occasional markets that offer goods, food or drinks for sale, a 2G verification requirement and an FFP2 mask requirement apply in closed rooms.  â¢	If there are more than 50 participants, the 2G rule and the recording of contact data do not apply to gatherings of a maximum of four people from fewer than three households plus six underage children of these people and minors for whom these people perform existing supervisory duties.  â¢	For meetings for rehearsals for professional purposes and for professional artistic performance in a fixed composition, the following also applies:  o	In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.   o	If a mask cannot be worn due to the activity, the risk of infection must be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	For meetings within the framework of the labor market service (training and further education, etc.), FFP2 mask requirements as well as 3G proof apply if physical contact cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures. If it is not possible to wear a mask due to the nature of the training or the integration measures of people, the risk of infection must be minimized by means of suitable protective measures.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20211217202434/https://corona-ampel.gv.at/aktuelle-massnahmen/bundesweite-massnahmen/

Rules are relaxed for the non-vaccinated/those without 2G proof over the Christmas period.  Participating in small gatherings of up to ten people is allowed from 24-26 December.    **Nationwide Measures: Special regulation for the Christmas holidays and New Year's Eve 2021**  The following special rules apply to the Christmas holidays (December 24, 25 and 26, 2021):  â¢	The exit restriction for people without 2G proof does not apply.  â¢	Participation in private celebrations of up to 10 people is possible.  â¢	The night curfew (from 11 p.m.) is suspended.    Source: https://archive.vn/7k1YB#selection-1111.0-1207.45 [Nationwide Measures]

Restrictions on gatherings for those without 2G proof are lifted for NYE (for up to ten people).    **Coronavirus - Current Measures**  "The upcoming festivities at the turn of the year require particular caution due to the rapid expansion of Omikron in Austria. Because of this, larger gatherings on New Year's Eve and New Year's are not recommended - celebrate in a small group, in a safe and tested setting! It is also pointed out that despite the lifting of the exit restrictions for unvaccinated people, small family or private gatherings are currently only permitted with up to 10 people. There is no obligation to provide evidence. Meetings between 10 and 25 people, on the other hand, may only take place with valid 2G proof, here the statutory curfew at 10:00 p.m. applies.    "After 10 p.m., a maximum number of people must be observed for gatherings of 10 people."    **Nationwide measures: Special regulation for New Year's Eve 2021**  The following special rules apply to New Year's Eve:  â¢	The exit restriction for people without 2G proof does not apply.  â¢	Participation in private celebrations for up to 10 people is possible.  â¢	The legal curfew from 10 p.m. also applies to New Year's Eve. Public transport  An FFP2 mask must be worn in closed rooms when using cable cars and cog railways, mass transportation and the associated stations, platforms, stops, train stations and airports as well as their respective connecting structures.    The following applies to the use of cable cars and cogwheel railways:  â¢	The operator may only let people in if they can show proof of 2G. The person must have this proof available for the duration of the stay.  â¢	People who use the cable car or cog railway to cover the basic needs of daily life do not have to provide proof of 2G, but wear an FFP2 mask.  â¢	The operator of cable cars and cog railways has to appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.    The use of coaches and excursion boats in occasional traffic is prohibited.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

"Exit restrictions:  â¢  All day exit restrictions  â¢  Exceptional reasons for leaving your own private living area are:      â Avoidance of an immediate danger to life, limb and property      â Care and help for people in need of support as well as the exercise of family rights and the fulfillment of family duties      â Covering the basic needs of daily life:           â¢ Necessary errands of daily life,           â¢ Contact with individual close relatives, important caregivers or the partner who does not live in the household           â¢ Health care including the way to the corona vaccination and testing for  SARS-CoV-2           â¢ Covering basic religious needs           â¢ Animal care & veterinary visits      â Professional and educational purposes, if necessary      â Stay outdoors for physical and mental relaxation      â Perception of administrative or judicial processes that cannot be postponed      â Participation in elections provided by law      â Entering certain customer areas      â To attend certain meetings, such as , inter alia, funerals and demonstrations."    Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

Nationwide measures    Exit regulation  There are no all-day exit restrictions for people with a 2G certificate, only a curfew from 11 p.m. for restaurants. Children under the age of 12 are exempt from the exit restrictions.    All-day exit restrictions apply to people without 2G proof. Leaving one's own private living area (including residential units in accommodation establishments, retirement and nursing homes, stationary residential facilities for the disabled) and staying outside one's own private living area is only permitted for the following purposes:  â¢	Avoidance of an immediate danger to life, limb and property.  â¢	Care of and assistance for people in need of support as well as exercise of family rights and fulfillment of family duties.  â¢	Covering the necessary basic needs of daily life, such as in particular  o	the contact with the partner who does not live in the same household, individual close relatives (parents, children and siblings) and important reference persons, whereby a household may only meet one other person from a second household,  o	the supply of basic goods of daily life,  o	the use of health services,  o	the coverage of a housing requirement,  o	the satisfaction of basic religious needs,  o	as well as the care of animals.  â¢	professional and educational purposes.  â¢	Staying outdoors alone, with people from the common household or people for physical and mental relaxation.  â¢	to pursue administrative or judicial processes that cannot be postponed.  â¢	to participate in elections provided by law and to use the instruments of direct democracy provided by law.  â¢	for the purpose of entering customer areas of certain business premises, such as pharmacies, grocery stores, drugstores, health and care services, petrol stations, banks, postal service providers, car and bicycle workshops, picking up pre-ordered meals, etc.).  â¢	Participation in certain gatherings, e.g. extracurricular youth education, top-class sport, etc.    **Coronavirus - Current Measures**    Exit restrictions  Persons without a valid 2-G certificate:  â¢	â¢All day exit restrictions  â¢	â¢Exceptional reasons for leaving your own private living area are:  o	âAvoidance of an immediate danger to life, limb and property  o	âCare and help for people in need of support as well as the exercise of family rights and the fulfillment of family duties  o	âCovering the basic needs of daily life:  ?	â¢necessary errands of daily life,  ?	â¢Contact with individual close relatives, important caregivers or the partner who does not live in the household  ?	â¢Health care including the way to the corona vaccination and testing for SARS-CoV-2  ?	â¢Covering basic religious needs  ?	â¢Animal care & veterinary visits  o	âProfessional and educational purposes, if necessary  o	âStay outdoors for physical and mental relaxation  o	âPerception of administrative or judicial processes that cannot be postponed  o	âParticipation in elections provided by law  o	âEntering certain customer areas  o	âTo attend certain gatherings, such as funerals or demonstrations    People with a valid 2-G certificate  There is a curfew from 11 p.m. for gastronomy.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/mKGBo [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/XRh8n  [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

Exit regulation  There are no all-day exit restrictions for people with a 2G certificate, only a curfew from 11 p.m. for restaurants. Children under the age of 12 are exempt from the exit restrictions.  All-day exit restrictions apply to people without 2G proof. Leaving one's own private living area (including residential units in accommodation establishments, retirement and nursing homes, stationary residential facilities for the disabled) and staying outside one's own private living area is only permitted for the following purposes:  â¢	Avoidance of immediate danger to life, limb and property.  â¢	Care of and assistance for people in need of support as well as exercise of family rights and fulfillment of family duties.  â¢	Covering the necessary basic needs of daily life, such as in particular  o	the contact with the partner who does not live in the same household, individual close relatives (parents, children and siblings) and important reference persons, whereby a household may only meet one other person from a second household,  o	the supply of basic goods of daily life,  o	the use of health services,  o	the coverage of a housing requirement,  o	the satisfaction of basic religious needs,  o	as well as the care of animals.  â¢	professional and educational purposes.  â¢	Staying outdoors alone, with people from the common household or people for physical and mental relaxation.  â¢	to pursue administrative or judicial processes that cannot be postponed.  â¢	to participate in elections provided by law and to use the instruments of direct democracy provided by law.  â¢	for the purpose of entering customer areas of certain business premises, such as pharmacies, grocery stores, drugstores, health and care services, petrol stations, banks, postal service providers, car and bicycle workshops, picking up pre-ordered meals, etc.).  â¢	Participation in certain gatherings, e.g. extracurricular youth education, top-class sport, etc.      Sources:   https://web.archive.org/web/20211217202434/https://corona-ampel.gv.at/aktuelle-massnahmen/bundesweite-massnahmen/  https://web.archive.org/web/20211217201842/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html

Nationwide measuress: Exit regulations  All-day exit restrictions apply to people without 2G proof. Leaving one's own private living area (including residential units in accommodation establishments, retirement and nursing homes, stationary residential facilities for the disabled) and staying outside one's own private living area is only permitted for the following purposes:    â¢	Avoidance of an immediate danger to life, limb and property.  â¢	Care of and assistance for people in need of support as well as exercise of family rights and fulfillment of family duties.  â¢	Covering the necessary basic needs of daily life, such as in particular  	o	the contact with the partner who does not live in the same household, individual close relatives (parents, children and siblings) and important reference persons, whereby a household may only meet one other person from a second household,  	o	the supply of basic goods of daily life,  	o	the use of health services,  	o	the coverage of a housing requirement,  	o	the satisfaction of basic religious needs,  	o	as well as the care of animals.  â¢	professional and educational purposes.  â¢	Staying outdoors alone, with people from the common household or people for physical and mental relaxation.  â¢	to pursue administrative or judicial processes that cannot be postponed.  â¢	to participate in elections provided by law and to use the instruments of direct democracy provided by law.  â¢	for the purpose of entering customer areas of certain business premises, such as pharmacies, grocery stores, drugstores, health and care services, petrol stations, banks, postal service providers, car and bicycle workshops, picking up pre-ordered meals, etc.).  â¢	Participation in certain gatherings, e.g. extracurricular youth education, top-class sport, etc.    There are no all-day exit restrictions for people with a 2G certificate, only a curfew from 11 p.m. for the catering trade. Children under the age of 12 are exempt from the exit restrictions.    Source: https://archive.vn/7k1YB [Nationwide measures]

Rules are relaxed for the non-vaccinated/those without 2G proof over the Christmas period.  The exit restriction is lifted from 24-26 December.    **Nationwide Measures: Special regulation for the Christmas holidays and New Year's Eve 2021**  The following special rules apply to the Christmas holidays (December 24, 25 and 26, 2021):  â¢	The exit restriction for people without 2G proof does not apply.  â¢	Participation in private celebrations of up to 10 people is possible.  â¢	The night curfew (from 11 p.m.) is suspended.    Sources:   https://archive.vn/7k1YB#selection-1111.0-1207.45 [Nationwide Measures]  https://archive.vn/o5SYg [2nd amendment to the 6th COVID-19 Protective Measures Ordinance]

Exit restrictions for those without a valid 2G certificate are reinstated.    Persons without a valid 2-G certificate:  â¢  All day exit restrictions  â¢  Exceptional reasons for leaving your own private living area are:  	-o Avoidance of an immediate danger to life, limb and property  	-o Care and help for people in need of support as well as the exercise of family rights and the fulfillment of family duties  	-o Covering the basic needs of daily life:  		â¢ necessary errands of daily life,  		â¢ Contact with individual close relatives, important caregivers or the partner who does not live in the household  		â¢ Health care including the way to the corona vaccination and testing for SARS-CoV-2  		â¢ Covering basic religious needs  		â¢ Animal care & veterinary visits  		â¢ Professional and educational purposes, if necessary  		â¢ Stay outdoors for physical and mental relaxation  		â¢ Perception of administrative or judicial processes that cannot be postponed  		â¢ Participation in elections provided by law  		â¢ Entering certain customer areas  		â¢ To attend certain gatherings, such as funerals or demonstrations    Persons with a valid 2-G certificate  For restaurants there is a curfew from 11 p.m., from December 27, the curfew will apply from 10 p.m.    Source: https://archive.fo/JYJX7#selection-2743.0-3043.100 [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

The exit restriction for people without 2G proof does not apply.on NYE.    **Coronavirus - Current Measures**  "The upcoming festivities at the turn of the year require particular caution due to the rapid expansion of Omikron in Austria. Because of this, larger gatherings on New Year's Eve and New Year's are not recommended - celebrate in a small group, in a safe and tested setting! It is also pointed out that despite the lifting of the exit restrictions for unvaccinated people, small family or private gatherings are currently only permitted with up to 10 people. There is no obligation to provide evidence. Meetings between 10 and 25 people, on the other hand, may only take place with valid 2G proof, here the statutory curfew at 10:00 p.m. applies.    "After 10 p.m., a maximum number of people must be observed for gatherings of 10 people."    **Nationwide measures: Special regulation for New Year's Eve 2021**  The following special rules apply to New Year's Eve:  â¢	The exit restriction for people without 2G proof does not apply.  â¢	Participation in private celebrations for up to 10 people is possible.  â¢	The legal curfew from 10 p.m. also applies to New Year's Eve. Regulations for entering Austria  The 8th amendment to the COVID-19 Entry Ordinance 2021 comes into force on November 27th . Due to the new virus variant Omicron, there is a tightening of the entry into Austria:     â¢ Classification of the following countries as virus variant areas ("Appendix 2 of the Entry Regulation "):  Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho, Mozambique, Namibia, Zimbabwe, South Africa     â¢ Entry from these countries is generally prohibited     â¢ In essence, only Austrian citizens and people with a place of residence or habitual abode in Austria are allowed to enter the country. Entry for humanitarian reasons or in the urgent interest of the republic is also possible. There are also a few other exceptions.     â¢ The following rules apply to these people upon entry:  	o Registration for pre-travel clearance at https://entry.ptc.gv.at/  	o Presentation of a negative molecular biological test result ( PCR test); the sampling must not be more than 72 hours ago  	o Immediate start of a ten-day quarantine. The quarantine is deemed to have ended if a further PCR test is carried out at the earliest on the fifth day after entry, the result of which is negative. The day of entry is to be regarded as "day zero".     â¢ In addition, flights from these seven African countries will be banned from landing.    Source: https://archive.vn/5GEjm#selection-2627.0-2879.85 [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

"Angola, Malawi, and Zambia have been added to the list of virus-variant countries, which also comprises Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho, Mozambique, Namibia, South Africa, and Zimbabwe. Flights from these countries are prohibited from landing in Austria. This entry ban also applies to people who have been in these countries in the last 10 days; limited exceptions apply. In addition to the above entry requirements, any permitted travelers arriving from, or having visited, a virus-variant area in the last 10 days must complete an online pre-travel clearance form within 72 hours before entry and self-isolate for 10 days; travelers may end the quarantine period early by obtaining a negative PCR result on the fifth day after entry."    Source: https://archive.vn/s2pgg [GardaWorld]

Landing bans added to Appendix A: Denmark, the Netherlands, Norway and the United Kingdom.    "Entry rules from December 25, 2021  "In order to curb the global spread of the Omikron variant, the entry rules  to Austria are tightened .  â¢	Classification of four additional countries as virus variant areas (Appendix 1 of the entry regulations) : Denmark, the Netherlands, Norway and the United Kingdom. There is no landing ban for flights from these countries!  â¢	In addition, the following countries are still considered virus variant areas , flights from these countries are also subject to a landing ban: Angola, Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho, Malawi, Mozambique, Namibia, Zambia, Zimbabwe and South Africa.  â¢	The following applies to persons who are authorized to enter from these countries:  	o	Registration for pre-travel clearance OR proof of vaccination via a further dose (" booster ") and molecular biological test (e.g. PCR test , not older than 48 hours)  	o	Proof in the sense of the 2-G rule.    "Entry into Austria is only possible with a valid proof of vaccination or recovery or a medical certificate. These documents must be issued in Latin script in German or English.  o	Negative molecular biological test (e.g. PCR test not older than 72 hours)  o	Immediate commencement of a ten-day quarantine OR proof of vaccination via a further dose ("booster") and molecular biology test (e.g. PCR test, not older than 48 hours)    "Due to the data available to Omikron entry of virus variant areas for will triple vaccinated persons in case of a max. 48 hours old negative PCR tests quarantine freely allows. People who have been vaccinated twice with Johnson & Johnson are allowed to enter the country free of quarantine if they have a negative PCR test that is not more than 48 hours old."    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20211230171039/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html#einreiseregeln-ab-dem-25-dezember-2021 [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

Landing ban and entry restrictions for virus variant areas in place.    A landing ban for flights and an entry ban is currently in effect for the following virus variant areas:  â¢	Angola  â¢	Botswana  â¢	Eswatini  â¢	Lesotho  â¢	Malawi  â¢	Mozambique  â¢	Namibia  â¢	South Africa  â¢	Zambia  â¢	Zimbabwe    The United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Denmark and Norway are currently classified as virus variant countries. This means:  â¢	People who are fully vaccinated (double jabbed) AND have received the 3rd booster jab can enter Austria with a negative PCR test (valid 48 hours). Children under the age of 12 are exempt (see below)!  â¢	If you have recovered from Covid and then received two jabs or the other way around, this counts as a booster as well. However, you still need a negative PCR test (valid 48 hours).  â¢	People arriving from the UK can find more information here.    Source: https://archive.vn/x8Gba [Austria.info: Entry Regulations for Austria]

Clearance and mouth and nose protection  When entering public places in closed rooms, an FFP2 mask or a mask with at least an equivalent standardized standard must be worn.     Children up to the age of 6 do not have to wear an FFP2 mask or an MNS. Children from the age of 6 up to the age of 14 may also wear an MNS or a close-fitting mechanical protective device. Pregnant women are also allowed to wear an MNS or a close-fitting mechanical protective device.    A distance of 2 meters should be kept to people outside the household.    An FFP2 mask must be worn in closed rooms when using cable cars and cog railways, mass transportation and the associated stations, platforms, stops, train stations and airports as well as their respective connecting structures.    Entering the customer area of ??business premises is only permitted for customers with an FFP2 mask. If, due to the nature of the service, the customer cannot wear an FFP2 mask, this is only permitted if the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.    At work an FFP2 mask should be worn if physical contact with people cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

Coronavirus - Current Measures    Mask requirement  An FFP2 mask is compulsory in all closed rooms. This also applies at the workplace (unless other suitable protective devices are available).    Distance obligation  There is no prescribed minimum distance to people from another household. However, it is recommended that people outside the household be kept at a distance of 2 meters.    Nationwide measures    Clearance and mouth and nose protection  When entering public places in closed rooms, an FFP2 mask or a mask with at least an equivalent standardized standard must be worn. Pregnant women are also allowed to wear an MNS or a close-fitting mechanical protective device.  A mask must be worn when vehicles are used jointly by people who do not live in the same household.  A distance of 2 meters should be kept to people outside the household.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/mKGBo [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/XRh8n  [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

Wiener Zeitung article on booster and additional fourth vaccinations for certain groups.    The National Vaccination Board (NIG) reacted to the threatened rapid spread of the Omikron variant of the coronavirus and updated its recommendations on Thursday evening. In addition to the general recommendation to increase the vaccination rate with the third bite as quickly as possible, it is also about the fourth vaccination. The NIG does not generally recommend this, but it should be offered in the high-risk and system-critical area from six months after the third stitch.    That would affect the particularly exposed health workers. The prerequisite is that the person concerned expressly requests this and a doctor has made an individual assessment; it is an off-label vaccination. "There is still no evidence that this additional vaccination can prevent infections. However, it can be assumed that it can prevent serious illnesses," said the recommendations of the NIG.    Source: https://archive.vn/Ye7CI#selection-1979.0-2035.128 [Wiener Zeitung]

Retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled    It is forbidden to enter retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled.  â¢	Exceptions:  o	Residents  o	People who are required to care for the residents or to operate the facility,  o	Visits as part of palliative and hospice support, pastoral care and support in critical life events,  o	Visits with a maximum of two people per resident per day,  o	In addition, a maximum of two people per resident in need of support per day, if they perform regular support and care tasks,  o	an additional maximum of two people per day to accompany underage residents of inpatient residential facilities for the disabled  o	external service providers, legally defined representatives, bodies of care supervision or members of established commissions.   â¢	Residents should wear an FFP2 mask in places that are generally accessible and not part of the living area.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. This also applies to operators.  â¢	The  planned measures must not be disproportionate or lead to unreasonable hardship.    The following applies to visitors:  â¢	The operator may only let in visitors and accompanying persons if they can show proof of 2G and also have a negative PCR test that was not accepted more than 72 hours ago. In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.  â¢	The visitor or the accompanying person must have this proof available for the duration of the stay.  â¢	The operator may only let in visitors and accompanying persons if they wear an FFP2 mask at all times during the visit or stay.    The following applies to employees:   â¢	The operator is only allowed to let employees in if they show proof of 2G. Alternatively, a valid PCR test can be presented. In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.  â¢	Employees must wear an FFP2 mask in closed rooms.    The following applies to operators:  â¢	The operator of retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled may only let residents in for new admission if they can present a 2.5G certificate.  â¢	The operator of retirement and nursing homes must offer the residents an antigen test for SARS-CoV-2 or a molecular-biological test for SARS-CoV-2 at least every three days if they have left the home within this period.  â¢	The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

Retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled  Entering old people's and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled is only permitted under certain conditions:  â¢	Visitors: indoor limit: a maximum of two visits per resident and day are permitted,  o	an additional maximum of two people per day to accompany underage residents of inpatient residential facilities for the disabled  o	In addition, a maximum of two people per resident in need of support per day if they perform regular support and care tasks. In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.  o	Exceptions: visits as part of palliative and hospice support, pastoral care and support in critical life events, external service providers, legally defined representatives, bodies of care supervision or members of established commissions.   â¢	When entering retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled, residents in generally accessible places that do not belong to the living area as well as visitors and accompanying persons must wear a mask.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. This also applies to operators.  â¢	The planned measures must not be disproportionate or lead to unreasonable hardship.  The following applies to visitors:  â¢	The operator may only let in visitors and accompanying persons if they can show proof of 2G and also have a negative PCR test, which was accepted no more than 72 hours ago. In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.  â¢	The operator may only let in visitors and accompanying persons if they wear an FFP2 mask at all times during the visit or stay.  The following applies to employees:   â¢	The operator is only allowed to let employees in if they show proof of 2G. If such a test cannot be presented, a valid PCR test must be presented. In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.  â¢	Employees must wear an FFP2 mask in closed rooms.  The following applies to operators:  â¢	The operator of retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled may only let residents in for new admission if they can present a 2.5G certificate.  â¢	The operator of old people's and nursing homes must offer the residents an antigen test for SARS-CoV-2 or a molecular biological test for SARS-CoV-2 at least every three days if they have left the home within this period.  â¢	The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/mKGBo [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/XRh8n  [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

Schools are open for a mix of in-person and remote learning.    https://web.archive.org/web/20211217142041/https://az.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-for-azerbaijan/

As of June 10, 2021, beaches, sport and health centers, places of religious worship, malls, and shopping centers are reopened, subject to COVID-related restrictions.  On September 2, 2021, the Cabinet of Ministers announced that foreigners may use their COVID-19 passport (or a document confirming full vaccination against COVID-19 or immunity to COVID-19) issued abroad to enter restaurants, hotels, large shopping centers, and other facilities that require a COVID-19 passport.    https://web.archive.org/web/20211217142041/https://az.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-for-azerbaijan/

In order to contain transmission of the virus, mass events and celebrations have been cancelled. We suggest you refrain from attending mass events, crowded venues and public gathering areas unless necessary.    https://web.archive.org/web/20211218155153/https://azerbaijan.travel/covid-19-en

In order to contain transmission of the virus, mass events and celebrations have been cancelled. We suggest you refrain from attending mass events, crowded venues and public gathering areas unless necessary.    https://web.archive.org/web/20211218155153/https://azerbaijan.travel/covid-19-en

Most public transportation, including the Baku Metro, reopened on May 31 for weekday operations, and resumed weekend operation beginning October 1, 2021.  https://web.archive.org/web/20211217142041/https://az.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-for-azerbaijan/
Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? No.    https://web.archive.org/web/20211217142041/https://az.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-for-azerbaijan/

Citizens and residents of Russia, Turkey, the United States, Bahrain, the UAE, Great Britain, Israel, Hungary, Qatar, Germany, Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Ireland, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Canada, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Serbia, Singapore, Slovenia, Slovakia, Greece, China, Estonia, Finland, France, Hong Kong, Croatia, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Malaysia, Saudi Arabia, Japan, Argentina, Australia, Brazil, Brunei, South Korea, Chile, Ecuador, Cambodia, Costa Rica, Cuba, Kuwait, Kazakhstan, Maldives, Mexico, Morocco, Mongolia, Montenegro, Norway, Oman, Panama, Salvador, Uruguay and New Zealand are able to travel to Azerbaijan by air under the following conditions:  submission of an official document issued by the relevant country (COVID passport) on complete vaccination or recovery from COVID-19 for passengers over 18 years of age and a negative PCR test taken within 72 hours before the flight  submission of a negative PCR test taken within 72 hours before the flight for passengers aged from 1 to 18 years  Restrictions on travelling to and out of Azerbaijan by air or land are in force until the 1st of January 2022, except for cargo and charter flights.    https://web.archive.org/web/20211218155153/https://azerbaijan.travel/covid-19-en
The participants have also agreed to broaden awareness campaign.    https://web.archive.org/web/20211019005253/https://nk.gov.az/en/article/1233/

Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in Azerbaijan? Yes  If so, are test results reliably available within one calendar day? Yes  COVID-19 testing is available in Baku. Individuals are responsible for the entire cost of COVID-19 tests and the cost is in the range of 100 AZN.  The labs listed on AZALâs website are accredited by the Management Union of Medical Territorial Units (TABIB) to offer COVID-19 tests.  Test results can be available by email or text message, depending on the procedures of each individual lab.  https://web.archive.org/web/20211217142041/https://az.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-for-azerbaijan/

Fines for Non-Compliance    Effective May 31, masks are not required outdoors, but remain obligatory inside and on public transportation.  Non-compliance with mask mandates can result in fines up to 600 AZN.    https://web.archive.org/web/20211217142041/https://az.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-for-azerbaijan/

Has the government of Azerbaijan approved a COVID-19 vaccine for use?  Yes.  Are vaccines available in Azerbaijan for U.S. citizens to receive?  Yes.   Which vaccines are available in Azerbaijan?  According to a Ministry of Health announcement, the Pfizer vaccine is available to citizens 18 years and older at the Baku Health Center and the outpatient clinic of the Central Clinic Hospital.  SinoVacâs CoronaVac and Russiaâs Sputnik V vaccine are widely available.  Local media reports AstraZeneca vaccines are also available.  Please monitor local media for updates.    https://web.archive.org/web/20211217142041/https://az.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-for-azerbaijan/
If you are over 65, stay home    https://web.archive.org/web/20211218160319/https://koronavirusinfo.az/az

Schools are currently open. However, children (starting from 6 years old) must wear a face mask. If 2 children from the class have tested positive then the class must close. Children in secondary education sometimes have classes at home and sometimes at school. Kindergartens and primary schools will close starting December 18.    Archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20211212145939/https://www.info-coronavirus.be/en/faq/

Current economic measures in place have been extended to December 31, 2021. The five socio-economic support measures that are extended until December 31, 2021 are as follows: Temporary unemployment due to force majeure for all sectors, The simple crisis gateway right for all sectors from a loss of 65% of turnover, A monthly bonus of 25 euros for beneficiaries of integration income, a GRAPA or an ARR Financial support for rail operators (people and freight) and Maintaining the VAT rate at 6% on hydroalcoholic gel and masks    Archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20211003171205/https://www.premier.be/fr/prolongation-ciblee-des-mesures-de-soutien-economique-jusquau-31-decembre-2021

The use of the facemask is now compulsory for all children above the age of 6, however, for education, communities decide whether or not to introduce compulsory masks for children under 12.    The use of the facemask is now required in the following circumstances: The Consultative Committee decided to generalise the wearing of masks, which will now be compulsory in the following situations:  in enclosed areas of public transport and organised collective transport;  for medical and non-medical professions;  in health care institutions;  in establishments and places where catering activities are organised;  in the context of events, both indoors and outdoors and regardless of the size of the event;  in shops and shopping centres;  in publicly accessible areas of companies, public administrations, etc;  in public buildings and courts;  in libraries, toy libraries and media libraries;  in publicly accessible areas of establishments in the cultural, festive, sports, recreational and event sectors;  in fitness centres;  in places of worship.    Archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20211127092653/https://www.commissioner.brussels/en/updates-covid-19/item/888-covid-updates-17-11  https://web.archive.org/web/20211212145939/https://www.info-coronavirus.be/en/faq/

The use of the facemask is now compulsory for all children above the age of 6, however, for education, communities decide whether or not to introduce compulsory masks for children under 12.    The use of the facemask is now required in the following circumstances: The Consultative Committee decided to generalise the wearing of masks, which will now be compulsory in the following situations:  in enclosed areas of public transport and organised collective transport;  for medical and non-medical professions;  in health care institutions;  in establishments and places where catering activities are organised;  in the context of events, both indoors and outdoors and regardless of the size of the event;  in shops and shopping centres;  in publicly accessible areas of companies, public administrations, etc;  in public buildings and courts;  in libraries, toy libraries and media libraries;  in publicly accessible areas of establishments in the cultural, festive, sports, recreational and event sectors;  in fitness centres;  in places of worship.    Archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20211127092653/https://www.commissioner.brussels/en/updates-covid-19/item/888-covid-updates-17-11

The document below shows the various interventions put in place by the government for the protection of the elderly in health institutions, with staff members and visitors above the age of 12 required to use a facemask during visits. Occupants of homes where the vaccination coverage is greater than 90% are allowed to participate in some activities.
